options.text: 0.1% of impurities in sewage water also consist of suspended solids like fecal matter, bacteria, paper fibres, etc.
Mauve-coloured flowers are a characteristic feature of the world's most problematic weed.
Algal blooms cause deterioration of the water quality but do not cause any harm to other aquatic life, like fish.
Biomagnification refers to the decrease in concentration of the toxicant at successive trophic levels.

solution.text: Beautiful mauve-colored flowers are found on very appealingly-shaped floating plants in water bodies. These plants which were introduced into India for their lovely flowers have caused havoc by their excessive growth by causing blocks in our waterways. They grow faster than our ability to remove them. These are plants of water hyacinth (Eichhornia crassipes), the world’s most problematic aquatic weed, also called ‘Terror of Bengal’. They grow abundantly in eutrophic water bodies, and lead to an imbalance in the ecosystem dynamics of the water body.
